1.text: Man born of a woman, living for a short time, is filled with many miseries.

2.text: Who cometh forth like a flower, and is destroyed, and fleeth as a shadow, and never continueth in the same state.

3.text: And dost thou think it meet to open thy eyes upon such an one, and to bring him into judgment with thee?

4.text: Who can make him clean that is conceived of unclean seed ? is it not thou who only art?

5.text: The days of man are short, and the number of his months is with thee: thou hast appointed his bounds which cannot be passed.

6.text: Depart a little from him, that he may rest, until his wished for day come, as that of the hireling.

7.text: A tree hath hope: if it be cut, it groweth green again, and the boughs thereof sprout.

8.text: If its root be old in the earth, and its stock be dead in the dust:

9.text: At the scent of water, it shall spring, and bring forth leaves, as when it was first planted.

10.text: But man when he shall be dead, and stripped and consumed, I pray you where is he?

11.text: As if the waters should depart out of the sea, and an emptied river should be dried up:

12.text: So man when he is fallen asleep shall not rise again; till the heavens be broken, he shall not awake, nor rise up out of his sleep.

13.text: Who will grant me this, that thou mayest protect me in hell, and hide me till thy wrath pass, and appoint me a. time when thou wilt remember me?

14.text: Shall man that is dead, thinkest thou, live again? all the days in which I am now in warfare, I expect until my change come.

15.text: Thou shalt call me, and I will answer thee: to the work of thy hands thou shalt reach out thy right hand.

16.text: Thou indeed hast numbered my steps, but spare my sins.

17.text: Thou hast sealed up my offences as it were in a bag, but hast cured my iniquity.

18.text: A mountain falling cometh to nought, and a rock is removed out of its place.

19.text: Waters wear away the stones, and with inundation the ground by little and little is washed away: so in like manner thou shalt destroy man.

20.text: Thou hast strengthened him for a little while, that he may pass away for ever: thou shalt change his face, and shalt send him away.

21.text: Whether his children come to honour or dishonour, he shall not understand.

22.text: But yet his flesh, while he shall live, shall have pain, and his soul shall mourn over him.
